header.gameNote: SUN BELT MEN'S CHAMPIONSHIP - 1st ROUND AT HOT SPRINGS AR

article.headline: FIU 53, Denver 49
article.story: HOT SPRINGS, Ark. -- Nine players scored as Florida International used a balanced attack to hold off cold-shooting Denver 53-49 on Saturday night in the first round of the Sun Belt Conference tournament. Jeremy Allen scored 14 points to lead the No. 6 seed Panthers (11-18), who advance to face No. 2 seed Middle Tennessee on Sunday. Marvin Roberts added 12 points for Florida International, which led by as many as 17 points in the second half. Denver (13-17) defeated the Panthers 79-70 in overtime on Jan. 15. The No. 3 seed Pioneers shot 45 percent from the field in that win, but the shooting didn't carry over to Saturday. After hitting just 5 of 22 shots (22.7 percent) in the first half, Denver's shooting woes continued. The Pioneers were 6-of-30 shooting midway through the second half before recovering to shoot 17 of 51 (33 percent) for the game. Brian Stafford led Denver with 22 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
